items.title: Warning: Covid-era ‘lockdown wills’ at increased risk of legal challenge
items.description: Pressures caused by the pandemic led some people to rush their wills. Now, lawyers are saying problems are surfacing that could make them invalid

items.title: Gilt yields fall to lowest level since 2024
items.description: The cost of government borrowing is falling. A new bond issuing strategy could be helping bring gilt yields down.

items.title: How the mansion tax could affect you even if your home is valued below £2 million
items.description: The mansion tax will apply to homes worth above £2 million from April 2028 but even lower-value properties could be looked at, MPs have been told.

items.title: Revealed: The 10 UK locations which could see the biggest house price growth in 2026
items.description: Scotland leads the way for house price growth in 2026 according to Zoopla, but what regions will do the best in 2026?

items.title: Could pensions inheritance tax rule change create liquidity crisis for Sippholders?
items.description: Pension inheritance tax rule changes from April 2027 could create a liquidity crisis for some self-invested personal pensions (Sipps) holding commerci...
